quizzes.question: What is the main purpose of the PACE mission?
options: To study plankton, aerosols, and clouds to understand Earth’s climate
quizzes.correct: To study plankton, aerosols, and clouds to understand Earth’s climate

quizzes.question: Which of the following instruments is used on the PACE mission?
options: Advanced Spaceborne Thermal Emission and Reflection Radiometer (ASTER)

quizzes.question: What type of data is PACE expected to collect?
options: Ocean color, aerosols, and clouds data
Data on human activity in space
quizzes.correct: Ocean color, aerosols, and clouds data

quizzes.question: Which of the following areas is *not* a focus of the PACE mission?
PACE will help scientists study the interactions between which components?
When is the PACE satellite expected to launch?
Why is PACE important for studying climate change?
options: It will measure gases in the upper atmosphere
It will provide detailed data on plankton, aerosols, and clouds, which influence Earth's climate
It will map the ocean floor
quizzes.correct: It will provide detailed data on plankton, aerosols, and clouds, which influence Earth's climate

quizzes.question: How will PACE contribute to oceanography?
options: By measuring ocean color and understanding biological activity in the ocean
quizzes.correct: By measuring ocean color and understanding biological activity in the ocean

quizzes.question: What is one unique capability of PACE's instruments?
options: It can measure ocean color at high spectral resolution
It can drill into the ocean floor
It can detect life on other planets
quizzes.correct: It can measure ocean color at high spectral resolution
